summary:
I am an open-minded and passionate individual. I am very experienced in, and attuned to, the world of fashion. I was previously based in Milan, Italy for 5 and a half years, where I acquired in-depth knowledge of the Italian fashion industry and its place in the global market. I gained this understanding through the roles of Trend Specialist and, previously, Assistant Buyer within the Buying department of Rinascente (a group of 9 department stores with its main luxury flagships in Milan, Florence and Rome). Whilst there, I learnt to speak Italian fluently and conduct business in both Italian and English. Eventually, I decided I wanted new experiences aside from working in the world of corporate retail.

Living in Amsterdam since the beginning of 2020, I have been working in an Italian Wine Bar situated in the Jordaan. During this time, and over the pandemic, I had the chance to nurture my passion for environmentalism and sustainability. I also had the opportunity to put it into practice in the independent restaurant where I worked. Through considerable research, I have re-assessed my aspirations, and now I am determined to make a difference in the fashion industry for a brighter, sustainable future.

profile_positions.description:
Specifically recruited into this newly established role within the Fashion Office of the Buying Department, whose strategic purpose was to help implement a coherent creative vision for the company. 

This involved:
∙	Creating up-to-date real-time runway overviews for New York, London, Milan and Paris
∙	Creating in-depth Trend Forecast reports for the coming season, presented to the Buying department
∙	Thoroughly researched reports for the current season, presented to Buying, Marketing and companywide Sales departments detailing seasonal themes, product from directional to commercial, colour trends and catwalk overviews
∙	Attending trade fairs and fashion weeks to analyse trends and discover new brand opportunities
∙	Collecting information from all buying teams to liaise with the Marketing department about relevant popups, events and brand/product launches to communicate to our clients (via online magazine, Instagram and website)
∙	Selecting product alongside Conde Nast stylists and Visual Merchandisers in store, determined by trends and needs of the Company, to use for in-house photoshoots
∙	First point of contact in office for the pop-up calendar managing time allocations to each buying department to ensure equal representation whilst pushing new and/or best-selling brands

In this role, my ability to filter and analyse relevant information, as well as my critical eye for fashion and unfolding trends, directly influenced buying decisions across womenswear, menswear and beauty.
profile_positions.title: Trend Specialist

profile_positions.description:
From September 2016 I was a key member of the small team responsible for all aspects of buying luxury shoes for Rinascente. It involved the forecasting, management and tracking of merchandise from the suppliers to the shop floor. Though I became familiar with hundreds of shoe brands, I focused on major players such as Casadei, Balenciaga and Marni as well as niche brands like Marskinryyppy, Rejina Pyo and Giannico, whose presence was less assured. I regularly accompanied the Buying Manager on showroom visits and aided in the selection and merchandising of product for the various stores.
During my time in this role, overall luxury shoe sales rose significantly. I also trained and managed buying interns with a view to the future development of the department.

Until September 2016 I was attached to the team for Jewellery, Watches and Women’s Shoes, I gained great insight into how these buying areas are managed. I also learnt how to gather and analyse the data required for forecasting buying needs. This also extended to the department store Illum, Copenhagen during the initial takeover and renovation by Central Retail Corporation (holding group of Rinascente).
